title: GPU Specification
description: Schema for GPU Agent GPU specification data

name.description: Unique identifier slug for the GPU

category.description: GPU market segment: gaming (consumer graphics cards), workstation (professional visualization), or datacenter (enterprise/AI compute)

msrpUSD.description: Manufacturer's Suggested Retail Price in USD at launch. SOURCING REQUIREMENTS: Must be sourced from (1) the manufacturer's official website domain (nvidia.com, amd.com, intel.com), OR (2) verified by 3 independent credible sources, OR (3) for enterprise GPUs without official MSRP, an 'estimated MSRP' based on market pricing within 90 days of launch from 3+ sources (Wikipedia, tech news, reseller pricing at launch). All MSRP sources MUST be included in the references array. A note explaining the MSRP source MUST be added to the notes array. For estimated MSRPs, prefix note with 'Estimated MSRP of $XXX USD...' and explain the basis. For enterprise GPUs, note that pricing may vary by form factor (PCIe vs SXM) and memory size. Use null ONLY when no pricing data is available even from launch-time sources. For NVIDIA consumer cards, use Founder's Edition pricing.

tensorCoreCount.description: Number of tensor cores or AI accelerators (null if not applicable)

int8TOPS.description: 8-bit integer non-sparse (dense) performance in TOPS. For GPUs with 2:4 structured sparsity (e.g. NVIDIA Ampere+), use the dense value without sparsity for fair cross-vendor comparison. Sparse performance is typically 2x dense. Null if not applicable.

maxTDPWatts.description: Maximum thermal design power in watts

gpuArchitecture.description: GPU architecture name (e.g., Ampere, RDNA 3, Blackwell)

supportedHardwareOperations.description: List of supported hardware operations (e.g., FP16, INT8, TF32)

supportedCUDAComputeCapability.description: CUDA compute capability version for NVIDIA GPUs

lastModified.description: Last modified timestamp in ISO 8601 format

summary.description: Detailed summary of the GPU specifications and features

references.description: URLs to reference documentation and specs

notes.description: Additional notes about the specifications and how they were calculated

manufacturerIdentifiers.description: Official identifiers from the GPU manufacturer (NVIDIA, AMD, Intel). Only include model numbers, part numbers, and SKUs - NOT PCI device IDs or other hardware bus identifiers. Manufacturers often have MULTIPLE identifier types - for example, NVIDIA uses both 'Product SKU' (e.g., PG133 SKU 242) AND 'NVPN' part numbers (e.g., 900-2G133-0080-000). Include ALL official identifiers found in datasheets and product documentation.

type.description: The type of identifier. Common types by manufacturer: NVIDIA: 'product_sku' (e.g., 'PG133 SKU 242'), 'nvpn' (e.g., '900-2G133-0080-000'), 'board_id' (e.g., 'PG133'). AMD: 'opn' (Ordering Part Number), 'model_number'. Intel: 'product_code', 'mm_number' (Material Master), 'spec_code'. DO NOT include PCI device IDs, vendor IDs, or other hardware bus identifiers.

value.description: The identifier value exactly as shown in official documentation

thirdPartyProducts.description: Products from third-party companies (OEMs, AIB partners) based on this GPU. These are companies that manufacture graphics cards using the GPU chip. For datacenter GPUs: Dell, HP/HPE, Lenovo, Supermicro, PNY. For consumer GPUs: ASUS, MSI, Gigabyte, EVGA, Sapphire, PowerColor, XFX, Zotac, PNY. A single company may have MULTIPLE products with different identifiers - include them as separate entries.

company.description: Company name. Use consistent names: 'Dell' (not 'Dell Technologies'), 'HP' or 'HPE', 'ASUS' (not 'Asus'), 'MSI', 'Gigabyte', 'PNY', 'EVGA', 'Sapphire', 'PowerColor', 'XFX', 'Zotac', 'Supermicro', 'Lenovo'

productName.description: The company's official product name for this card (e.g., 'NVIDIA L40S 48GB GDDR6 350W PCIe x16 DW FHFL GPU' for Dell, 'ROG STRIX GeForce RTX 4090 OC Edition' for ASUS)

identifier.description: The identifier value (part number, SKU, or model number). IMPORTANT: This must be a unique identifier, NOT the product name. If identifier equals productName, the entry is invalid and should be removed.

identifierType.description: Type of identifier: 'part_number' = Internal inventory/ordering code, often alphanumeric (e.g., Dell '7WK28', HP 'L57056-001', Supermicro 'GPU-NRTXA6000-AC'). 'sku' = Stock Keeping Unit, retail/sales identifier (e.g., PNY 'TCSL40SPCIE-PB'). 'model_number' = Consumer-facing product identifier (e.g., ASUS 'ROG-STRIX-RTX4090-O24G-GAMING').
